Juliana Nazaré

LinkedIn | Github | Twitter | Instagram

Bio

I am a PhD student in the Lab for Social Machines at the MIT Media Lab, advised by Prof. Deb Roy. My research focuses on tools and community networks for family engagement in children's early literacy learning. Prior to starting my PhD, I completed my Master's in the Lifelong Kindergarten Group, advised by Mitch Resnick and Philipp Schmidt, where I worked on technology embeded in family literacy programs.

I revieced by BSc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Olin College of Engineering. While in college, I built curriculum and taught at Startup Institute, and interned at MIT Lincoln Laboratory and Advanced Micro Devices.

Originally, I'm from a social experiment called Reston, Virginia.
